headline: Does Verizon’s ESOP Share Filing and Frontier Deal Oversight Reshape Its Utility-Like Profile (VZ)?
summary: Verizon Communications recently filed a shelf registration for 750,000 common shares valued at about US$29.18 million for an ESOP-related offering, while contending with tighter regulation tied to its US$20.00 billion Frontier fiber acquisition and ongoing competitive pressure in wireless. Analysts increasingly describe Verizon as a high-yield, bond-like telecom utility with heavy debt and limited flexibility, highlighting how dividend commitments and regulatory obligations may constrain its...

headline: Oil Earnings, Inflation Data, Likely Fed Chair Decision: Still to Come This Week
summary: More earnings are due, as well as a reading on monthly supplier inflation. headline: Verizon forecasts upbeat annual profit as wireless subscriber growth hits six-year high
summary: Verizon forecast annual profit and free cash flow above market expectations on Friday, as aggressive promotions during ​peak holiday period helped the U.S. carrier post its highest ‌quarterly wireless subscriber additions in six years. In the fourth quarter, telecom operators often rely ‌on device promotions and bundled plans to poach customers looking to switch carriers amid peak phone-buying during Black Friday and Cyber Monday deals. Verizon's promos, such as four phone lines for $100 per month, resonated with users, ⁠helping it add 616,000 ‌monthly bill-paying wireless phone subscribers in the last three months of 2025.

content.title: Verizon forecasts upbeat annual profit as wireless subscriber growth hits six-year high
content.summary: Verizon forecast annual profit and free cash flow above market expectations on Friday, as aggressive promotions during ​peak holiday period helped the U.S. carrier post its highest ‌quarterly wireless subscriber additions in six years. In the fourth quarter, telecom operators often rely ‌on device promotions and bundled plans to poach customers looking to switch carriers amid peak phone-buying during Black Friday and Cyber Monday deals. Verizon's promos, such as four phone lines for $100 per month, resonated with users, ⁠helping it add 616,000 ‌monthly bill-paying wireless phone subscribers in the last three months of 2025.

headline: Verizon shares rise as Q4 results and 2026 outlook top expectations
summary: Investing.com -- Verizon Communications Inc. (NYSE: VZ) reported fourth-quarter earnings and revenue that exceeded analyst expectations, while providing an upbeat outlook for 2026 that signals the beginning of a strategic turnaround. The telecommunications giant's shares rose 4.1% following the announcement.

The telecommunications giant's shares rose 4.1% following the announcement.

headline: Verizon (NYSE:VZ) Beats Q4 CY2025 Sales Expectations
summary: Telecommunications giant Verizon (NYSE:VZ) beat Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q4 CY2025, with sales up 2% year on year to $36.38 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $1.09 per share was 3.3% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

content.title: Verizon (NYSE:VZ) Beats Q4 CY2025 Sales Expectations
content.summary: Telecommunications giant Verizon (NYSE:VZ) beat Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q4 CY2025, with sales up 2% year on year to $36.38 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $1.09 per share was 3.3% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Verizon: Q4 Earnings Snapshot
summary: The New York-based company said it had net income of 55 cents per share. Earnings, adjusted for severance costs and non-recurring costs, came to $1.09 per share. The results surpassed Wall Street expectations.

content.title: Verizon: Q4 Earnings Snapshot
content.summary: The New York-based company said it had net income of 55 cents per share. Earnings, adjusted for severance costs and non-recurring costs, came to $1.09 per share. The results surpassed Wall Street expectations.

headline: Verizon Posts Strong Subscriber Gains in Its First Quarter Under New CEO
summary: Verizon Communications  gained a net 616,000 postpaid phone connections in the fourth quarter, with its chief executive calling the period a “critical inflection point.”  Dan Schulman  took over as chief executive officer of the nation’s largest wireless carrier in October with a mandate to execute cost cuts and a strategic turnaround after it lost ground to rivals.  This month he faced a major test as many Verizon customers lost service during an hourslong network outage.

content.title: Verizon Posts Strong Subscriber Gains in Its First Quarter Under New CEO
content.summary: Verizon Communications  gained a net 616,000 postpaid phone connections in the fourth quarter, with its chief executive calling the period a “critical inflection point.”  Dan Schulman  took over as chief executive officer of the nation’s largest wireless carrier in October with a mandate to execute cost cuts and a strategic turnaround after it lost ground to rivals.  This month he faced a major test as many Verizon customers lost service during an hourslong network outage.

headline: Stock Index Futures Slip as Trump Picks Warsh for Fed Chair
summary: March S&P 500 E-Mini futures (ESH26) are down -0.40%, and March Nasdaq 100 E-Mini futures (NQH26) are down -0.47% this morning after U.S. President Donald Trump nominated Kevin Warsh as the next Federal Reserve chair.
